communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OSHA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications, between OSHA and the Burlington Northern Railroad, Santa Fe Railroad, Great Northern Railroad or Burlington Northern Santa Fe Railroad between 1994 and 2013 that contain the words “vermiculite” OR “asbestos” OR “W.R. Grace” OR “Libby” OR "Lincoln County" OR “tremolite” OR “Zonolite” OR “amphibole” OR "anthophyllite" OR "asbestiform" OR "chrysotile" OR "actinolite" OR "amosite" OR "anthophyllite" OR "crocidolite" OR "richterite" OR "winchite".

All complaints received by OSHA between 1994 and 2013 originating from employees of the Great Northern Railroad, Burlington Northern Railroad or Burlington Northern Santa Fe Railroad and relating to work performed in the state of Montana.

All warnings, citations, or fines issued to the Great Northern Railroad, Burlington North Railroad or Burlington Northern Santa Fe Railroad between 1994 and 2013 relating to any facilities or properties located in Montana.

All communications, between OSHA and the Association of American Railroads that were written, received or produced between 1994 and 2013 containing the words “vermiculite” OR “asbestos” OR “W.R. Grace” OR “Libby” OR "Lincoln County" OR “tremolite” OR “Zonolite” OR “amphibole” OR "anthophyllite" OR "asbestiform" OR "chrysotile" OR "actinolite" OR "amosite" OR "anthophyllite" OR "crocidolite" OR "richterite" OR "winchite".

All tests, reports and analysis of vermiculite originating from mines in Libby conducted by OSHA or otherwise in OSHA's possession produced or created between 1970 and 1993.

Please issue any and all responsive documents in certified format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin LaMarca

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IHSC Facility Staffing Requirements - Latest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of Al Otro Lado and its #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative, we request all currently effective IHSC Staffing Requirements for ICE facilities based on detention standard (NDS, PBNDS 2011, NDS 2019). 

We request updated versions of the two matrices ICE previously supplied in response to a FOIA request. Those matrices were from May 2018. We are requesting the most recent version  of these documents. 

This request seeks 3 tables. It is straightforward and requires a search of only a single custodian: ICE-ERO-IHSC. In the event a search of IHSC turns up nothing, we request an alternative search ERO-CMD, OAQ, and OCFO. 

We suggest an adequate search would include the terms “IHSC Minimum Staffing Requirements by Facility Size.”

We therefore ask that the agency designate this request for Simple Track Processing.  

Please note that our project, the #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative of Al Otro Lado, recently secured a partial judgment on the pleadings and a declaratory judgment in the US District Court for the Central District of California that ICE engaged in an unlawful pattern and practice of violating FOIA’s timing provisions. Owen v ICE, No 2022cv550 (CD Cal Jan. 12, 2023) (copy available here: https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/23689456/owen-v-ice-cd-cal-pattern-practice-declaratory-judgment.pdf.  We sincerely hope that the agency will heed the Owen Court’s admonitions that FOIA’s “‘deadlines are not aspirational — Congress set them and expected compliance’ and an ‘agency does not have the authority to ignore unambiguous deadlines set by Congress[.’]” Id at 15.  

Please provide this records and carry out all mandatory actions within the timeframes Congress required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s):

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Lorain (OH) Police Department Social Media
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records relating to the Facebook page located at https://www.facebook.com/LorainPD and the Twitter account @LorainPD. An example of what each of the Facebook records look like is attached and available at https://bit.ly/facebookfoia.

In order to access the requested information, you will first need to take the following steps:

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/LorainPD/?sk=professional_dashboard

I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu.

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/LorainPD/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/LorainPD/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/LorainPD/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/LorainPD/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

9. The list of blocked users on the Twitter account @LorainPD. This list is accessible by logging into the account as an administrator and navigating to this URL while logged into the account: https://twitter.com/settings/blocked.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Arrest of man filming and criticizing police officer
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any incident report, police report, or narrative relating to the arrest of Brandon Hong on the evening of February 17, 2023. The arrest was conducted by an officer with the number "77" displayed on his uniform. Hong's arrest occurred during the detention of an unknown third party.

2. Any body-worn camera footage and/or audio of any officer involved with or present during the arrest (of either Hong or the third party), including any recording made in the half hour before the arrest.

3. Any vehicle-based video footage or audio footage from a vehicle present at the scene of the arrest (of either Hong or the third party). This request is limited to video or audio recorded half an hour before the arrest and one hour after the arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: ARREST CONSORTIUM
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking records about COPLINK and the ARREST Consortium. Some of these records were once public on the ARREST Consortium website at arrest.spokanepolice.org, others are internal agency records. The records include:

- ARREST MOU
- ARREST User Access Request Form
- ARREST Access Request Policy
- Internal Memos and communications about Coplink Success Stories
- The  Detect User Guide
-  Active Agent User Guide
- Visualizer User Guide
- Incident Analyzer User Guide	How to use the Analyzer component of Coplink.
- A3 Interface User Guide		
- Case Folders User Guide
- A roster of individuals who completed a training to use COPLINK - the list should include the individuals department.
- Record of individuals with access to COPLINK - the list should include the individuals department.
- Coplink 4.0 Fast Track Sheet	A quick start guide to using COPLINK 4.0
- COPLINK FAQS	Frequently asked COPLINK Questions
- Emails, Internal Memos or Communications referencing COPLINK'S FACEMATCH
- Any power point presentation, Liason Tip, or training document about COPLINK
- Emails between COPLINK Law Enforcement Liason, Mike Widmer, as well any other COPLINK representative

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Labor - Unemployment Equity Data (Employment And Training Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Labor - Unemployment Equity Data (Employment And Training Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records mentioning any evidence of systemic barriers that prevent any Americans from accessing unemployment benefits based on their race, age, ethnicity, language proficiency, disability status, geographic location, or other systemic barrier. 
For purposes of this request, these terms have the same meaning as they are used in the Department's News Release of Feb. 9, 2023, available at:  https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/eta/eta20230209-0.

Responsive records will include any record in a system of records maintained by the Department of Labor or the Employment And Training Administration that: 1) mention any systemic barrier in place in Connecticut, New Jersey, or Oklahoma, OR  2) mention any systemic barrier to unemployment benefits identified in previously "announced award of more than $180 million in funds to 35 states and the District of Columbia."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

AFL
